@guozhangwang @ewencp I ran into a couple of issues when going through the streams quickstart for 0.10.2.0-RC1 (http://kafka.apache.org/0102/documentation.html#quickstart_kafkastreams). I had addressed these issues a while back, but looks like those changes are reverted by a recent PR.

Please see further explanation inline. Your feedback is appreciated.

@ewencp It seems to be [this one](https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2482).

@becketqin : Good point on overriding the topic config with an invalid message format. We can address this better with the ConfigChangeRequest.

@mjsax np. In general, I am familiar with KIP process
So is there some existing KIP related with this PR (if yes, can you provide the number) or should I create KIP for this PR and discuss in mailing list?

Updated this as #2488 got merged.
@guozhangwang

@vahidhashemian Thanks, that's what I thought -- that was the PR trying to bring things back inline.

I'm going to merge this to trunk and 0.10.2. Ideally this shouldn't hold up the release since we can easily regenerate and redeploy the 0.10.2 docs after the release (since the are always just the latest version available on that release branch).

We don't have a KIP. Please, use the template to create a new KIP page, add it to the table "KIPs under discussion" (and to Kafka Streams page in the Wiki) and start a DISCUSS thread on the dev mailing list. Thanks a lot!

I remember merging them on kafka-site repo but obviously copy-paste overrides them. We should consider having a nightly job for making the current trunk's web doc visible as well, like `0.10.3.0-SNAPSHOT/documentation` so that people only need to touch on kafka repo.

Thanks @vahidhashemian for the quick find and @ewencp for the quick response!

@guozhangwang The alternative, of course, would be to make it so viewing the current copy of the docs didn't require so much setup... I've given in, but requiring having Apache specifically installed and not just supporting running a web server (e.g. python's SimpleHTTPServer that is available pretty much everywhere out of the box), is incredibly annoying. It means pretty much nobody except committers that are going to updates kafka-site ever properly test whether docs will render ok.
@guozhangwang Can you give write access to @jeyhunkarimov to the Kafka wiki so he can prepare the KIP ?

As AK web docs gets fancier (we even have discussed about moving it from html docs to rst), I think such complexity would be hard to avoid. Having nightly builds for trunk may actually help with this, such that as long as people can accept some commits causing the web doc / links to be broken the next day, such commits can be fixed forward / reverted back in time, instead of piled only at the release time.
@jeyhunkarimov what is your apache id?
